general_city_data.attractions: Bom Jesus do Monte, Braga Cathedral, Sanctuary of Sameiro, Arco da Porta Nova, Garden of Santa Bárbara, Biscainhos Museum, Roman Baths of Alto da Cividade.
general_city_data.description: Braga, one of Portugal's oldest cities, is a captivating blend of ancient history and youthful energy. Known as the "Rome of Portugal" due to its numerous churches and religious significance, Braga boasts a rich architectural heritage, from Roman ruins to stunning Baroque churches. Beyond its religious landmarks, Braga is a vibrant university town, filled with students, modern shops, and bustling cafes. Its well-preserved historic center offers a charming atmosphere, while its surrounding gardens and parks provide tranquil escapes. Braga is a city where tradition and modernity intertwine, offering a unique and engaging experience for visitors.
general_city_data.history: Braga's history dates back to Roman times, when it was known as Bracara Augusta. It became an important religious center in the Middle Ages and served as the capital of Portugal for a brief period. The city has played a significant role in Portuguese history and culture, and its religious heritage continues to be a defining characteristic.
general_city_data.timezone: UTC+0 (WET - Western European Time); UTC+1 (WEST - Western European Summer Time)
general_city_data.weather: Mediterranean climate with warm, dry summers and mild, wet winters.

itinerary_response.overall_description: This itinerary focuses on exploring the historical and religious significance of Braga, Portugal's oldest city. Prepare to be captivated by stunning architecture, serene gardens, and a palpable sense of history. This itinerary offers a flexible pace, allowing you to immerse yourself in the beauty and culture of Braga at your own speed. It includes key landmarks accessible by public transport or on foot, ensuring a convenient and enriching experience. Enjoy the journey through time as you uncover the hidden gems and iconic sights that define Braga's unique character.

points_of_interest.address: Rua Dom Paio Mendes, 4700-424 Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: The oldest cathedral in Portugal, a magnificent blend of Romanesque, Gothic, and Baroque styles. Explore its chapels, tombs, and treasury.
points_of_interest.name: Braga Cathedral (Sé de Braga)

points_of_interest.address: Rua de Santa Margarida, Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A beautiful public garden featuring meticulously manicured flower beds and a central fountain. A perfect place for a relaxing stroll.
points_of_interest.name: Jardim de Santa Bárbara

points_of_interest.address: Rua de São Marcos, Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A monumental arch marking the entrance to the city. Admire its Baroque design and historical significance.
points_of_interest.name: Arco da Porta Nova

points_of_interest.address: Estrada do Bom Jesus, Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A stunning sanctuary located on a hilltop, famous for its monumental Baroque staircase and panoramic views of Braga. Take a bus or funicular to reach the top.
points_of_interest.name: Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte

points_of_interest.address: Santuário do Bom Jesus, 4715-056 Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A prominent Portuguese sanctuary and pilgrimage site known for its monumental Baroque staircase. Offers stunning views of Braga.
points_of_interest.name: Bom Jesus do Monte
points_of_interest.opening_hours: Open daily, hours vary depending on the season. Check website for details.

points_of_interest.address: Rua Dom Paio Mendes, 4700-424 Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: The oldest cathedral in Portugal, showcasing a mix of Romanesque, Gothic, and Baroque architectural styles. A significant religious and historical landmark.
points_of_interest.name: Braga Cathedral (Sé de Braga)
points_of_interest.opening_hours: Open daily, 9:00-18:30 (times may vary, check website)

points_of_interest.description_poi: One of the largest Marian shrines in Portugal, known for its impressive architecture and religious significance. Offers panoramic views.
points_of_interest.name: Santuário do Sameiro
points_of_interest.opening_hours: Open daily, hours vary depending on the season. Check website for details.

points_of_interest.address: Rua de Santa Margarida, 4700-312 Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A beautiful public garden featuring colorful flowerbeds, geometric designs, and a medieval fountain. A peaceful oasis in the city center.
points_of_interest.name: Jardim de Santa Bárbara

points_of_interest.address: Rua de São Marcos, 4700-323 Braga, Portugal
points_of_interest.description_poi: A triumphal arch marking the western entrance to Braga. A notable example of Baroque architecture.
points_of_interest.name: Arco da Porta Nova

points_of_interest.description_poi: A stunning example of Baroque architecture, known for its blue-tiled facade. Houses the Interpretation Centre of Memórias da Misericórdia de Braga.
points_of_interest.name: Raio Palace (Palácio do Raio)

points_of_interest.description_poi: A museum housed in a beautiful Baroque palace, showcasing 17th and 18th-century decorative arts and furniture. Features stunning gardens.
points_of_interest.name: Museu dos Biscainhos
